intro: Phlomoides ghorana, commonly known as the Kashmiri phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
